thread.title: Jack Colback hopes Newcastle increase lead over Championship's 'irritating' chasing pack | Football News | Sky Sports
thread.title_full: Jack Colback hopes Newcastle increase lead over Championship's 'irritating' chasing pack | Football News | Sky Sports

author: Nick Lustig
title: Jack Colback hopes Newcastle increase lead over Championship's 'irritating' chasing pack | Football News | Sky Sports
text:
Jack Colback hopes Newcastle increase lead over Championship's 'irritating' chasing pack By Nick Lustig Last Updated: 20/02/17 12:23am Jack Colback wants Newcastle to restore a healthy lead over the chasing pack in the Championship Newcastle midfielder Jack Colback admits he is becoming increasingly irritated by the chasing pack in the Sky Bet Championship. 
The Magpies are on course to secure an immediate return to the Premier League and will leapfrog Brighton into top spot if they defeat Aston Villa at St James' Park on Monday , live on Sky Sports 1 HD from 7.30pm. Newcastle vs A Villa 
They and Brighton have led the Championship for the majority of the season, but both have been unable to break away with Huddersfield, Reading, Leeds and Sheffield Wednesday hot on their heels. 
"It's getting irritating now, actually," Colback said with a smile. 
"Of course you have a look at the other results. They are a part of the competition, you're going to have a look after games. Grab a NOW TV Sky Sports Day Pass and watch Newcastle v Aston Villa, all for just Â£6.99. No contract 
"We obviously focus on ourselves first. We know that we've put ourselves in a position where if we keep winning games or stay unbeaten and are consistent, then we'll go up so we will focus on that first and foremost." 
Newcastle, who have been boosted by the return of 20-goal striker Dwight Gayle from injury, can increase the gap between themselves and third-paced Huddersfield to eight points with a victory over Villa. Sky Sports' Danny Higginbotham discusses tactics ahead of the Sky Bet Championship clash between Rafa Benitez's Newcastle United and Steve Bruce's Aston Villa 
Colback added: "The gap obviously was a bit more healthy, they have closed the gap - credit to them because they keep winning games. But we've got to play everyone around us. Again it shows it's in our own hands."
